question: A friend is considering buying a house nearby, but you have decided to leave the area due to a rise in crime. Write a letter to your friend advising them not to move into the neighborhood. In your letter:- Recommend that your friend not go ahead with the purchase- Give the reasons behind your decision to leave- Suggest possible alternative areas that you know
text: I am writing this letter with regret to inform you about my next move as I decided to leave this area despite the close proximity to my office. Hence, I would recommend you not buy and move to this location as we may be terrified by some unwanted things.

As you heard, there are numerous crime situations evolving at a breathtaking pace daily which cannot be incalculable on 10th street, where you decided to move. In addition, local government bodies decided to stop all transport services right after 7pm daily to stop these crimes. Therefore it is   absolutely not possible in your case as you will be back  home at 9PM from the workplace. Having said that, please think twice before moving to this location.

However, we have some new locations on the west side which are close to your children's school facilities. If not, on the other side, we have a few new apartments in the middle of the town and I guess this location is also a good one if we ingone the skyrocketing  rents and other utilities charges.
I look forward to seeing you in a good community and I wish you all the best in your house search.
